techmeme.title: Reddit says content licensing deals with Google and OpenAI account for ~10% of its revenue, but its primary focus is on ad revenue, which grew 60% YoY in Q4 (Kendra Barnett/Adweek)
JioCinema and Disney+ Hotstar officially merge to launch JioHotstar, a new streaming service in India that brings together content from the two platforms (The Indian Express)
The UK renames its AI Safety Institute to AI Security Institute in a pivot to cybersecurity, and is exploring ways to use Anthropic's Claude in public services (Ingrid Lunden/TechCrunch)
Apple and Google are restoring TikTok to their US app stores on Thursday, following Trump administration assurances that a ban wouldn't immediately be enforced (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
Sources: Arm is recruiting executives from its own customers in a push to sell its own chips, and is competing against Qualcomm to sell data center CPUs to Meta (Reuters)
